Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Dryad \Dry"ad\, n. [L. dryas, pl. dryades, Gr. ?, pl. ?, fr. ? oak, tree. See {Tree}.] (Class. Myth.) A wood nymph; a nymph whose life was bound up with that of her tree. [1913 Webster]
dryad n : a deity or nymph of the woods [syn: {wood nymph}] [also: {dryades} (pl)]
